summary: In this chapter, Agnes reveals her scrapbook to David, showing him a disturbing photograph that connects him to a past resident of the building. The chilling realization frightens David, making him contemplate his possible fate within the building's walls. Following this unsettling revelation, David speaks with Art, who reflects on the building's dark history and offers warnings about its influence on residents. As David grapples with fear and the allure of a mysterious door that seems to embody his fate, his thoughts shift towards empowerment. He begins to understand that he can confront his past and alter his future, culminating in a moment of resolve when he vows not to succumb to despair. With renewed determination, he approaches Agnes to express his desire to rewrite his story, acknowledging the struggles ahead but remaining hopeful about the choices that lie before him.
